definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: I'm happy to be a part of a team that's a contender and looking forward to playoffs.
sentences.chinese: 我是快乐是一个竞争者的队一部份而且期望延长加赛。

sentences.english: In Playoffs, if a draw occurs, MR3 will be played.
sentences.chinese: 在季后赛，如果平局出现，将会进行MR3的加赛。

sentences.english: The score was 0∶0,so they are going to play off.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打成零比零，所以他们将加赛定胜负。

sentences.english: The superiority is very small, but they are flushing at least also ultra attach fence-off the row.
sentences.chinese: 优势很小，可他们至少还在冲超附加赛之列。

sentences.english: The last round they won 4 to 0 smoothly Malta, into the playoff.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮他们4比0顺利拿下马耳他，进入附加赛。

sentences.english: We missed the play-offs and ended in undignified fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我们错过了附加赛，而且以一种不体面的方式结束。

sentences.english: All the same, nobody should have been surprised at the seeding of the play-offs this year in particular.
sentences.chinese: 看看吧，今年附加赛的分档出炉时，有谁曾感到惊讶？

sentences.english: Hiroshi Ohashi, speaking before the play-off with Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 大桥浩司在同墨西哥队的附加赛之前说到。

sentences.english: Swindon are currently sixth in League One and in the play-off position.
sentences.chinese: 斯维顿目前排名英甲第六，拥有附加赛资格位置。

definition: victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
